title: Why didn't the Greeks nor the Romans begin the study of anthropology? Both had ample contact with peoples very different from themselves, and both knew how to ask philosophical questions. What were they missing? - Quora

response.answer_text: They did. They began what is known as “proto-anthropology.” Herodotus wrote about many different peoples and their physical and cultural peculiarities. Tacitus did some too. Some serious modern anthropologists credit Herodotus as the “father’ not only of history, but anthropology as well. History of anthropology - Wikipedia.
